description: The Syrian Health Ministry announced on March 24, 2020, a nationwide night curfew from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m. as a lockdown measure which will take effect on 25 March 2020.

The government team in charge of confronting the Coronavirus (COVID-19) announced on the 18th of April the alteration of the curfew duration across the country during the month of Ramadan, making it from 7:30 PM to 6 AM, while maintaining the restriction of movement between city centers and rural areas and between provinces. UPDATE: The government team in charge of confronting the Coronavirus (COVID-19) altered the curfew duration across the country during the month of Ramadan, making it from 7:30 PM to 6 AM, while maintaining the restriction of movement between city centers and rural areas and between provinces.
On March 20, the government banned entry for foreigners, after the first coronavirus victim reached Syria by road from Lebanon after returning from Europe.
Health officials have deployed medical teams at the national level and to 1,864 health clinics across the country.

The Syrian Government decided on a curfew to prevent the movement of citizens between centres of cities and countryside which came into effect on the 31st of March and is set to last until the 16th of April.

The Syrian Interior Ministry extended the curfew among provinces which prevents the commuting of citizens between province centres and all other urban and rural areas at all times excluding those with clearance 
set to last until April 16 to May 2nd. UPDATE: The original travel restriction referred to under the curfew measure by the Syrian government set to last until April 16 has been extended to May 2.

The Syrian Government with the curfew still in place until May 2nd has decided to allow citizens to travel among provinces on the 20th and 21st of April after putting medical teams at the entrance of each province. UPDATE: Curfew among provinces is still enforced until May 2 but the government is making an exception and allowing citizens to travel among provinces on the 20th and 21st of April.
On March 23, the government stepped up procedures for the supposed response to the epidemic by carrying out campaigns to sterilize cities and villages.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Syrian Health Ministry launched a service on its website which shows the distribution of registered Coronavirus cases in Syria, sorting them by provinces, age groups, gender, and cause of infection. The service also contains information on the 5 official labs that conduct COVID-19 tests, and the centers for quarantine and isolation.

On March 18, the Recruitment Directorate affiliated with the Syria regime forces announced the suspension of the issuance of driver's licenses and military service completion attestations until April 22.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government
